fields.description:
Proposed proof of concept: convert the "terminate __ instances" action on the instances landing page to a multi-select operation.

UPDATE: The instances landing page is not a good choice for a PoC here since the instances page may be reworked to move from a table-based to a list-based layout.
fields.summary: Tracer: Implement multi-select checkboxes on a landing page as a proof-of-concept for batch operations

comments.body: I've implemented a batch-release-to-cloud feature on the IP Addresses landing page in branch GUI-2057 as a proof of concept.  I'm going to enable another multi-select on that landing page and implement at least one more landing page to ensure the code is fairly reusable and keeps things DRY.

Notes from discussion with [~jloza] on 11/17:
- Place multi-select operations in a "More actions" button on landing pages
- Resources that aren't applicable to the selected operation should be filtered out when the batch operation is selected (e.g. don't include IP addresses already not associated with an instance when batch-selecting the "disassociate IP address" operation).

[~lnajjar]: Would you mind testing the multi-select features on the Elastic IPs landing page in branch GUI-2057 for me?  Feel free to reassign this back to me after your review since I'm going to implement multi-select checkboxes on the security groups landing page as well.

Kamal, I¹m trying to test the multi-select features on the Elastic IPs
landing page but there are no elastic IPs there (see attachment).

I don¹t know how to add elastic IPs. Do you?

Could you please add a few and let me know they are there?
[~lnajjar]: Use the "Allocate Elastic IP Addresses" button at the top of the landing page :-)

Nice start. Still a couple of quirks. I used Safari.

1. When the select-all checkbox is selected and I de-select one of the checkboxes, select-all remains selected. Select-all should probably de-select.

2. When select-all is selected and I de-select all of the row checkboxes, select-all remains selected. Select-all should probably de-select.

3. When select-all is selected and I click a row check box three times, it removes the entire row.

[~lnajjar]: I've fixed item #3 above.  I'll work on the de-select behavior for items 1 and 2, but a couple examples of select-all checkboxes I found (listed below) don't de-select the "all" checkbox when one is unselected, so could you confirm if that's the behavior we really want here?

- https://davidwalsh.name/demo/checkbox-all.php
- http://jsfiddle.net/FAYJS/378/

[~lnajjar]: I should also mention that the multi-select checkboxes are only implemented on the table view.  We should discuss whether that's good enough (i.e. I'm hoping we won't need to implement those on the tile view as well).

Yes, if select-all is checked on and the user de-selects one of the row check boxes, will you please de-select select-all? 

We're going to need to allow users to select a tile because users will need to see the associated graph on the metrics landing page.

Hey, Kamal. I had another idea that will help our users. 

If users collapse the rows for a select-all check box, users will see the select-all check box but will not know that some check boxes are selected on and some are off. 

When some of the sub-check boxes for a select-all check box row are on and some off, instead of displaying the select-all check box as off can you display the select-all check box in an indeterminate state (see attachment)?

 !Select-all check box indeterminate state.png|thumbnail! 

That way, users will know for a collapsed row that some of the collapsed sub-check boxes are on and some off.

So, three states:

1. None of the sub-check boxes are selected: Select-all check box is de-selected
2. All sub-check boxes selected: Select-all check box is selected
3. Some sub-check boxes selected: Select-all check box is indeterminate

[~lnajjar]: Unfortunately browsers only have two visible states for checkbox inputs, checked or not (although browsers offer a third "disabled" state for checkboxes, but that doesn't help us here).  Please advise.

I am way out of my depth here, but it looks like Javascript may provide an indeterminate state: [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1726096/tri-state-check-box-in-html] and [https://css-tricks.com/indeterminate-checkboxes/]

If that is not relevant and there are only checked-unchecked-disabled states, then how about checked but disabled?
[~lnajjar]: Ah, I wasn't aware of the indeterminate state -- will try that.  Thanks!

[~lnajjar]: I pushed a change that enables the indeterminate state for the select-all checkbox, but there are still a few quirks (even the sample code at http://jsfiddle.net/98BMK/ has a few issues).  Will continue to investigate, but we may need to punt on implementing the indeterminate state for now.  I'd like to avoid using the disabled state for the indeterminate state since a disabled checkbox would make it difficult to select/deselect all once that disabled state is reached.

I was just pondering this "indeterminate" state and wonder if that's a solution looking for a problem? Why not simply uncheck the checkbox if a user deselects one or more manually? Is there any real value here? I looked at the links, but I wonder if there are any studies showing this ought to be done?

I'm closing this tracer since the proof-of-concept work on the Elastic IPs landing page is complete.  Further implementation work (e.g. improving the select-all checkbox experience) will be tracked in GUI-2051 or related tickets to be opened.  Opened GUI-2272 for multi-select operations on the Elastic IPs landing page.

For a select-all check box, the indeterminate state tells users that some of the sub-check boxes are selected. Since the sub-checkboxes can be collapsed and out of view, we need to tell users that some of them are checked. See attachment.

Users need the indeterminate state.
